title: Mobile-Based Flipped Learning Engineering Mathematics Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering knowledge and high school-level mathematical proficiency
context.additional_context: An engineering mathematics course combining flipped learning and collaborative learning in smartphone-centric limited technological environments, with project-based assessments to enhance practical competencies

learning_goals: Learners can apply differential equation modeling techniques with 80% or higher accuracy by utilizing pre-learning content provided through mobile platforms.
Learners can explain mathematical approaches for solving engineering problems with 75% or higher participation through weekly online discussions and small-group activities.
By the end of the 6-month course, learners can develop and present a numerical analysis solution applicable to real-world work environments through project-based assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
